column4: I need help, I updated system to interpid, and rest you know.... system is broken
what happens when you run gksu nautilus?
please use the pastebin next time
what do you want to do with gksu nautilus?
you don't edit system files that way
besides, it seems that gconf is broken for all root apps
I do, and did for fe years
well, you run unnecessary risks that way. Use 'gksu gedit /path/to/file' instead.
try 'sudo gconftool --recursive-unset /' to fix your gconf problems
did you run the gconftool command I suggested?
try 'sudo gconftool --recursive-unset /' to fix your gconf problems
sorry, don't know how to fix that
